This statement uses the logical operator "or," which in common usage can be inclusive or exclusive. However, in formal logic, "or" is typically interpreted as inclusive unless specified otherwise. This means that at least one of the conditions must be true, but it is also possible for both to be true.

The inference we are considering is "The contract must have been approved by the legal team or it must have been approved by the CEO."
